description: Elm wood planks with horizontal plank construction, wild grain patterns, and characteristic zig-zag features

base_colors.note: Reddish brown elm base colors - warmer than oak, between oak and pine

alternating_variation.note: Moderate plank variation - between oak (+10,+8,+5) and pine (+15,+10,+5)

separation_lines.note: Strong separation lines - similar to oak but slightly stronger

wood_grain.note: Highest grain intensity of all wood types for elm's characteristic wild grain

blue_stability.note: Most aggressive blue stability adjustment of all wood types

zigzag_pattern.description: Elm's characteristic zig-zag pattern in planks
zigzag_pattern.note: Unique to elm wood - creates distinctive diagonal patterns

light_specks.description: Combined plank variation and zig-zag pattern

color_clamping.note: Reddish-brown range for elm wood - warmer than oak, distinctive from pine

generation_algorithm.step1: Calculate local pixel coordinates: pX_elm_planks = globalX % 16, pY_elm_planks = globalY % 16
generation_algorithm.step2: Start with elm base colors: finalR = 140, finalG = 95, finalB = 65
generation_algorithm.step4: Apply alternating plank variation: if plankY % 2 == 1, add (12,8,5)
generation_algorithm.step5: Generate triple wild grain: primary sin(0.9x + 0.4*plankY)*0.4 + secondary cos(0.6x)*0.3 + tertiary sin(1.2x - 0.3y)*0.2
generation_algorithm.step6: Apply grain adjustment with aggressive blue stability: grainAdjust = grainNoise * 18
generation_algorithm.step7: Apply horizontal plank separation lines: if pY_elm_planks % 4 == 0 && pY_elm_planks > 0, subtract (22,18,12)
generation_algorithm.step8: Apply elm zig-zag pattern: if (pX*3 + pY*2) % 7 < 2, add (8,5,3)
generation_algorithm.step9: Clamp colors to reddish-brown range: r[80-200], g[60-140], b[35-100]

unique_features: Horizontal plank system with 4-pixel height (same as oak/pine)
Triple noise wood grain system (vs dual noise for oak/pine)
Wild grain with cross-grain component (y-coordinate in tertiary noise)
Highest grain intensity of all wood types (18 vs oak's 12, pine's 15)
Unique elm zig-zag pattern using (pX*3 + pY*2) % 7 formula
Most aggressive blue channel stability (max(-8, adj-5))
Reddish-brown color palette distinctive from oak and pine
Moderate plank variation between oak and pine levels
wood_type_comparison: Base colors: Elm (140,95,65) vs Oak (160,130,95) vs Pine (80,50,20)
Plank variation: Elm (+12,+8,+5) vs Oak (+10,+8,+5) vs Pine (+15,+10,+5)
Grain complexity: Elm (triple noise) vs Oak/Pine (dual noise)
Grain intensity: Elm (18) vs Pine (15) vs Oak (12)
Special features: Elm (zig-zag pattern) vs Oak/Pine (none)
Blue stability: Elm (max(-8,adj-5)) vs Pine (max(-3,adj-2)) vs Oak (max(-5,adj-3))
